case_vignette: A 48-year-old man is brought to the    emergency department after he was found in a stuporous state with a small cut on his forehead on a cold night in front of h   is apartm   ent. multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I'm hearing threatening voices that aren't real and I have a headache. I also feel very distressed and sweaty, and my right hand has a slight shake.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I started hearing the voices and experienced other symptoms about twelve hours after I was brought to the emergency department.
Were you given any medications or treatments in the emergency department before these symptoms started?
No, I was just monitored in the emergency department.
Do you have a history of psychiatric illness, or is there a family history of psychiatric or neurological disorders?
No, I do not have a history of psychiatric illness, nor is there a family history of psychiatric or neurological disorders.
What were the reasons for you being monitored in the emergency department initially?
I was monitored because I was found in a stuporous state with a small cut on my forehead.
Have you been exposed to any toxins, chemicals, or used recreational drugs recently?
Yes, I drank a pint of vodka prior to admission and I occasionally smoke marijuana and use cocaine.
Final Diagnosis: Substance-induced psychotic disorder
